intro: Linaria parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, resembling those of the common toadflax. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Linaria parviflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate blooms.
